greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fully multiplicative with a(prime(k)) = Fibonacci(k+2).
comment: Numbers n such that a(n)=n are exactly 5-smooth numbers (A051037). - _Ivan Neretin_, Aug 30 2015
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If n = Product p(k)^e(k) then a(n) = Product Fibonacci(k+2)^e(k).
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = A000045(A000720(p)+2)^e. - _David W. Wilson_, Aug 01 2001
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, f[k,1] = fibonacci(primepi(f[k, 1])+2)); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 14 2021
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, _N. J. A. Sloane_.
